body.p: Mrs. Eli White Wing of Wittenberg was at Wausau doing some business of her own. She returned Saturday. Alpheus Long visited at Robert Big Thunder’s home Monday night. He is attending the Wausau Vocational School. Mrs. Robt. Big Thunder and daughter Violet also (Little) George White Wing and Emmerson Thunder Cloud of Rib Mountain C.C. C. camp in Wausau visited at Mes. Robert Big Thunder’s mother’s home in Dancy, Wis. They sure enjoyed the visit. Charles Smoke of Tomah passed away last week at the Tomah Indian Hospital. Robert Big Thunder, who is now at the Veteran’s Hspital near Milwaukee, has written to his family telling them that the snow is all gone round there. He said they had rain and that helper a grat deal to melt the snow. George White Wing has returned to his home in Wittenberg. He had been staying at his aunt’s place in Wausau. Nat H. Long was ill in bed last week, but now he is well and is working. Now for a smile! It is said that a government man or a case worker came to see Ed. Little Wolfe, and asked “Little Wolfe” various questions. When he got all the information he wanted, he asked “Little Wolfe” this question: “Mr. Little Wolfe, when was your wife born?” Then “Little Wolfe” sat and thought for a while. Finally he said: “Well, my wife was born when she was a baby.” .
